WorkItem.Description:
The is a weird behaviour when I start an application containing the RibbonWindow (for exemple: Soutridge sample app or the CheckbookManager sample app) on a dual screen configuration.
When the application is on the first screen all seems working.
When I move the application on my second screen, the minimize, restore and close buttons does not work.
The quick access toolbar does not work and only the buttom half of the application button can be clicked.
I cannot horisontally resize the window
 
If I move the application on the first screen all seems working again.
 
There is another bug:
The minimize, restore and close buttons does not use the skin of my computer it is really ugly.
I am running on Windows 2003 R2 and have the Media Center Style / Royale Color Scheme  Theme enabled on my PC.

Comments.Message:
Hi, thanks for reporting these issues.  I've filed a bug in our internal database to track this, and it will be fixed in an upcoming release.

Thanks!
Samantha
Something I have noticed is that after a brief period of time it seems to allow clicking on the buttons again. Its almost like a delay before registering it is on a new monitor.
